conclusion: Analyze the motion of the balls along the inclined plane using given distances AB and BC.
Balls are released from rest and roll down the inclined plane with uniform acceleration.
Balls are released at intervals of 0.1 seconds.
The difference in distances between AB and BC represents the acceleration effect over the time interval.
Acceleration can be calculated using the formula a = Δs/Δt² where Δs = BC - AB and Δt = 0.1 seconds.
Calculate acceleration: a = 5 cm / (0.1 s)² = 500 cm/s².
Ball B travels from A to B in 0.1 seconds and velocity can be calculated using v_B = u + at.
Calculate velocity of ball B: v_B = 0 + (500 cm/s² × 0.1 s) = 50 cm/s.
